full_text: Case 1:20-cr-00330-PAE Document 749 Filed 08/10/22 Page 163 of 236 LC3KMAX6 Parkinson - Direct 1 (Government's Exhibits 269, 271, 272, 273, 276, and 277 received in evidence) 2 MS. COMEY: Your Honor, may we please publish? 3 THE COURT: You may. 4 MS. COMEY: Ms. Drescher, let's please pull up 5 Government Exhibit 269. 6 Q. What do we see here? 7 A. This is looking through the double doors. It is a small 8 room, hallway, on the second floor. You are standing to the 9 east, looking to the west. 10 MS. COMEY: Let's go now, please, to 271. 11 Q. What do we see here? 12 A. This is the master bedroom. This is the master bed. And 13 you are standing to the south, looking to the north. 14 MS. COMEY: Let's go to 272, please. 15 Q. What do we see here? 16 A. This is the master bed. You're standing to the southeast, 17 looking towards the northwest. 18 MS. COMEY: Let's go to 273, please. 19 Q. What do we see here? 20 A. This is the second floor master bedroom, and if I'm not 21 mistaken, you're looking to the -- I'm lost on my direction on 22 that. 23 Q. But is this in the master bedroom? 24 A. It is. 25 SOUTHERN DISTRICT REPORTERS, P.C. (212) 805-0300 DOJ-OGR-00012677

text_blocks.content: (Government's Exhibits 269, 271, 272, 273, 276, and 277 received in evidence) MS. COMEY: Your Honor, may we please publish? THE COURT: You may. MS. COMEY: Ms. Drescher, let's please pull up Government Exhibit 269. Q. What do we see here? A. This is looking through the double doors. It is a small room, hallway, on the second floor. You are standing to the east, looking to the west. MS. COMEY: Let's go now, please, to 271. Q. What do we see here? A. This is the master bedroom. This is the master bed. And you are standing to the south, looking to the north. MS. COMEY: Let's go to 272, please. Q. What do we see here? A. This is the master bed. You're standing to the southeast, looking towards the northwest. MS. COMEY: Let's go to 273, please. Q. What do we see here? A. This is the second floor master bedroom, and if I'm not mistaken, you're looking to the -- I'm lost on my direction on that. Q. But is this in the master bedroom? A. It is.

additional_notes: The document appears to be a court transcript with a clear and readable format. There are no visible redactions or damage.
